Description: The United States reached a landmark global settlement with Education Management Corp. resolving allegations that EDMC violated federal and state False Claims Act provisions by falsely certifying that it was in compliance with Title IV of the Higher Education Act and parallel state statutes.

Education Management Corp. agreed to pay approximately $31 million to settle multistate litigation alleging that it violated False Claims Act provisions by falsely certifying that it was in compliance with Title IV of the Higher Education Act and parallel state statutes. This was part of a larger $95 million settlement involving the federal government; see the Violation Tracker entry at https://violationtracker.goodjobsfirst.org/violation-tracker/-education-management-corp. The case announcement did not mention the state figure explicitly but listed the total settlement amount and the other portions, suggesting that the remainder would go to the states.
